required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Analgesic Efficacy Supra-scapular Nerve RF After Breast Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Analgesic and Rehabilitative Value of Supra-scapular Nerve Radiofrequency in Patients With Chronic Shoulder Pain After Breast Surgery.

brief_summary.textblock: Eighty patients with chronic shoulder pain after breast surgery were allocated randomly into 2 groups; forty patients received fluoroscopically guided supra-scapular nerve pulsed radiofrequency (PRF) followed by injection of 0.25% bupivacaine solution containing 40 mg of methylprednisolone (group1) and forty patients received fluoroscopically guided supra-scapular nerve injection of of 0.25% bupivacaine solution containing 40 mg of methylprednisolone (group 2) without active pulsed radiofrequency only demo mode was applied.

detailed_description.textblock: Eighty patients with chronic shoulder pain after breast surgery were allocated randomly into 2 groups ; forty patients received fluoroscopically guided supra-scapular nerve pulsed radiofrequency (PRF) followed by injection through the radiofrequency needle of 0.25% bupivacaine solution containing 40 mg of methylprednisolone (group1) and forty patients received fluoroscopically guided supra-scapular nerve injection of 0.25% bupivacaine solution containing 40 mg of methylprednisolone (group 2) without active pulsed radiofrequency only demo mode was applied.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.description: shoulder mobility using long arm geniometry

arm_group.description: Eighty patients with chronic shoulder pain after breast surgery were allocated randomly into 2 groups (Figure1); forty patients received fluoroscopically guided supra-scapular nerve pulsed radiofrequency (PRF) followed by injection through the radiofrequency needle of mL of 0.25% bupivacaine solution containing 40 mg of methylprednisolone (group1)

and forty patients received fluoroscopically guided supra-scapular nerve injection of mL of 0.25% bupivacaine solution containing 40 mg of methylprednisolone (group 2) without active pulsed radiofrequency only demo mode was applied.

intervention.description: Sixty patients with shoulder dystocia after breast surgery will receive stellate ganglion neurolysis with supra-scapular nerve radiofrequency,

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with post-mastectomy pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion criteria are patients with any medical contraindications to neurolysis, patients with other bone metastases.
